page.title: 01CROOK-A VILLAGE IN CUMBRIA
page.content: THE VILLAGE OF CROOK IN THE OLD COUNTY OF WESTMORLAND,NOW CUMBRIA,LIES IN THE NATIONAL PARK,BEING A SPARSELY POPULATED AREA ON THE B5284 ROAD WHICH RUNS FROM KENDAL TO WINDERMERE.HOUSING IS VARIED AND SCATTERED WITH SMALL FARMS DOTTED HERE AND THERE.PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS VERY LIMITED AND AMENITIES ARE FEW.AFTER FARMING, TOURISM FEATURES LARGELY IN THE VILLAGE LIFE,WITH PROBABLY MORE CARAVANS ON ONE CAMPSITE THAN THERE ARE HOUSES IN THE AREA.FEW FIELDS ARE CULTIVATED FOR HAY OR SILAGE,MOST OF THE LAND BEING SUITABLE ONLY FOR ROUGH GRAZING,THE REMAINDER BEING COVERED BY A MIXTURE OF CONIFERS AND DECIDUOUS TREES WITH A SMALL FARM HERE AND THERE.THE RIVER KENT RUNS THROUGH A TINY PART OF THE AREA,AS DOES THE OXENHOLME TO WINDERMERE RAILWAY
